quest.name: The Gift of Mercy
journal: The blasphemy hunter is even more flustered than usual, and with good reason.

You find Raubahn engaged in an urgent linkpearl conversation with M'naago, whose search party has finally made contact with the errant Fordola. As previously surmised, she has been on the trail of her friend Charlet, with the intention of slaying him following his irreversible transformation into a blasphemy. Although she successfully predicted where the beast would appear, Fordola was soon spotted by Charlet, who turned and fled in the direction of Specula Imperatoris. Raubahn orders the troops to prevent the blasphemy from escaping until the two of you arrive.

In the time taken for you and Raubahn to reach Specula Imperatoris, M'naago and her team have been pushed to their limits by the rampaging Charlet, with only Fordola still fit to fight. She, however, faces an entirely different struggle, as her guilt for her part in the deaths of Charlet's brother and the Crania Lupi threatens to overwhelm her, and it is only the unexpected pleas of M'naago and the surprising arrival of Arenvald that pull her back from the brink. Her resolve renewed, she leads the charge against Charlet, and with support from you and the Bull of Ala Mhigo, she finally lays her childhood friend to rest.

You and your comrades are given a warm reception upon returning to the city. Even Fordola, the reviled war criminal, receives a hero's welcome from Lylie, the child whose life she had saved. In light of her continued service to Ala Mhigo, Raubahn intends to have the restrictions to her freedom eased to a degree. The suggestion that she may no longer be required to wear the enchanted choker─capable of claiming her life should she attempt to flee─elicits little in the way of an outward response, though you suspect this comes as welcome news all the same.

Raubahn offers his thanks for your cooperation in hunting down the blasphemy and the various services performed for the sake of Ala Mhigo. Before departing, he asks that you share your account with the ambassador to Radz-at-Han, who will be eager to hear of your exploits.

The ambassador and his Ul'dahn counterpart are─as one might expect─delighted to hear firsthand accounts of your triumphs. Having played an instrumental role in helping his countrymen overcome this recent crisis and begin to come to terms with their bloody past, you take a moment's repose before embarking on your next adventure.
objectives: Speak with the Ala Mhigan ambassador in Sundrop.

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: Thank goodness you're here─Commander Aldynn needs to see you right away! Follow me!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Keep it contained until I arrive─but do not engage if you can help it. Understood?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: That was M'naago.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Her unit has found Fordola. Or rather, she has found them.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: In fact, I have Fordola on the search party's linkpearl. She wants a word with you.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: (-Fordola-)This is urgent, so be quiet and listen.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: (-Fordola-)The blasphemy─my friend─is right in front of us.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: (-Fordola-)I tracked him down, and when he spotted me, he started heading towards Specula Imperatoris.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: (-Fordola-)Look, Forename─I need your help.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: (-Fordola-)Charlet's not─ He never wanted to hurt anyone. But this thing he's become is... I can't leave him like this.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: (-Fordola-)I've got to stop him, whatever it takes.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'm on my way.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Wait till we get there─do not engage. Is that clear?

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: (-Fordola-)I owe you.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: (-M'naago-)This is M'naago─can you hear me? We've got the blasphemy surro─

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: (-M'naago-)Ugh... It's on the move!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: (-M'naago-)Get ahead of it, but maintain distance! We need to─ Fordola! What are you doing!? Fordola! Fordola!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: There's no time to waste. They need our help!

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Rhalgr's beard...once she's got her mind set, there's no stopping her. She's convinced herself she's responsible for this mess─that she created the blasphemy single-handedly...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: All I ask is that you see she makes it out of this alive. She's come so far...and I don't want to lose her.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Radiata and Ala Ghiri are not that far from Specula Imperatoris. If we let the blasphemy slip through our fingers...it doesn't bear thinking about.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And while Fordola is determined to slay it by her own hand, we can't allow her recklessness to put the lives of others in jeopardy.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The time has come for action. Are you ready?

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Hold the line...for as long as you can!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Commander Aldynn and the Warrior of Light will be here any moment─stay strong!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: You've done well. Leave the rest to us.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Yes, sir!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Get the injured to safety!

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: Coward... Coward...

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: Traitor...to them... To everyone...

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: I wish there was another way.

dialogue.name: ANSFRID
dialogue.text: So do I, but fighting's the only thing I'm any good at. Makes me wonder how I ended up with such a clever brother.

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: Too clever for my own good, maybe. Just the thought of going into battle...about getting hurt. About having to hurt other people...

dialogue.name: HRUDOLF
dialogue.text: He's a bleeding heart, our Charlet. Sooner befriend a fly than shoo it away─much less kill it!

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: I c-could kill if I wanted! I could...

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: But you don't─and there's no shame in that. Leave the soldiering to us, Charlet. We'll show the Garleans what we're capable of. Get the power and respect we deserve. And then...things'll change. They will. You'll see.

dialogue.name: EMELIN
dialogue.text: We've found a place for ourselves, and you'll find yours soon enough.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: All right, that'll do. Everyone who's enlisting, meet back here tomorrow.

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: ...In the end, what good did I do?

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: They gave everything they had to give...while I hid, like a rat waiting for the storm to pass.

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: Coward... Coward... Coward!

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: Uwaaaaaah!

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: Coward... Coward...

dialogue.name: CHARLET
dialogue.text: Better dead... Better forgotten...

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: It's not your fault, Charlet. It's not... You didn't do anything wrong... And I...

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: I'm the coward! The traitor! The Butcher! I'll always be...the Butcher...

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Don't you dare, Fordola!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: You don't get to end it. You don't get to give up. I won't let you!

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: You have a lifetime to make amends and atone. To become something more than you were. But if you die here, you are everything they say. Everything you believe.

dialogue.name: MNAAGO
dialogue.text: Is that what you want!?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: (-???-)She's not going anywhere.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Arenvald... Why are you here...?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: There's nowhere else I'd rather be.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I can't fight by your side, but I can still cheer you on.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I've seen your past, Charlet. How you were left behind while your friends rushed into battle.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: It's bloody hard, isn't it? Wanting to do something so desperately, with every fiber of your being, knowing that you should─should be able to, you should...but you can't.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: So you find another way to support them. Your way. You did that too, didn't you? You were there for them, even if it didn't feel like it, but you were, Charlet. You were.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: As a friend of mine once said...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: ...Not all heroes are forged in the fires of battle.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The history of Ala Mhigo is writ in blood.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: While we cannot change the past, we can change the future.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And for that, we must all play our part. All of us.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Let us grant Charlet the peace he deserves.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You too, Fordola.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Ansfrid, Emelin...one day, we'll be together again. But not yet.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: You'd never hurt anyone, Charlet. That's not who you are.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: You'll be remembered as the kind soul you always were.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: I'm counting on you.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Thank you. I mean it.

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: I've been looking everywhere for you!

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: Have you now?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We've put down the last remaining beasts spawned by the blasphemy. 'Tis a pity we could do naught for those who'd turned, but that we were able to prevent further casualties is nothing short of a miracle.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: It's astonishing, too, looking back at Charlet's case. Although his existence spurred others to transform, he never attacked any settlements or travelers. Even when he underwent the change in the middle of a crowded street, those who were present escaped with minor injuries at worst.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I think that deep down, his compassion is what kept the raging blasphemy at bay.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: The only time he emerged from hiding was to journey to the place where his brother died...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Aye, it's clear he still retained some semblance of his former self. <sigh> Another victim of the Empire's terrible legacy, along with his friends and so many others.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: But the Crania Lupi wasn't the creation of the imperials alone. Many of those youths sought a place with them because they were denied one with us.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: That's why the memorial ceremony is so important. It's our chance to face our past together─to give them in death what we couldn't in life. To not deny anyone a place in memory, even if it hurts or makes us feel ashamed.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: You'll be attending, won't you?

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: I haven't been ordered to, so I suppose not.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: In light of your leal service to Ala Mhigo...I intend to have the conditions by which you are bound eased. Providing I'm able to obtain approval, you will be granted a degree of freedom...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: At the very least, we should soon have no need for that choker.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: There'll be no objections from me. You've done well.

dialogue.name: FORDOLA
dialogue.text: ...Hmph.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: If I didn't know better, I'd think you were smiling!

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Well, I for one couldn't be happier her efforts are being recognized. It gives me that much more motivation to continue my work with the Silver Griffins and bring the people of Ala Mhigo closer together.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Got to do my best to keep up with a certain little lordling, aye?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I think we've done enough for one day. Time we got some rest.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Allow me─as both the guardian of Ala Mhigo and as your sworn comrade─to express my thanks for coming to our aid in these desperate times.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: No matter what manner of disaster may befall us, your presence alone is enough to keep the flame of hope burning bright.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Aye, even someone on the very precipice of despair such as Fordola can find salvation in your guiding light.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Laying it on a bit thick, aren't you?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Heavens forbid people would stop throwing themselves in harm's way at every opportunity...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You're something of an immortal flame yourself!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Am I? Hmm... Both M'naago and Arenvald said much the same thing. I must be getting soft in my old age.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And put you healers out of a job? Not a chance! Heh... Though in all seriousness, we could all stand to take fewer risks.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hah! Been waiting for a chance to use that one, haven't you? I like to think I can still pull my weight on and off the battlefield, but that might be a bit generous.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: In any case, it's safe to say we've all benefited enormously from your sterling work here. We couldn't ask for a better healer─or a better friend.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Our ambassador in Radz-at-Han will be relieved to learn of our successes here. If you happen to cross paths, give him my regards, would you?

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: We've heard you've been doing a lot of good work in Ala Mhigo and in Ul'dah. Still, who better to tell the tale than the hero of the hour!

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Greetings. How goes it in Ala Mhigo?

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Eliminating blasphemies, helping organize a memorial ceremony... They've certainly kept you busy.

dialogue.name: ULDAHMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: A fine example of going above and beyond the call of duty! I'll be sure to send word of your exploits to Ul'dah. Wait till the sultana hears about this!

dialogue.name: ALAMHIGOMILITARYATTACHE
dialogue.text: Her Grace will not be the only one to welcome this news. On behalf of the Grand Company of Eorzea and our allies, allow me to express my most heartfelt gratitude.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can now dye the job-specific gear for level 90 healers.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Job-specific gear will become available once you have fulfilled certain conditions within the main scenario quests for Endwalker.
